title: FF! Doc | CompressPipe
listItems: GZ Gzip format. It is used when compressing (compress="true") and resultIsContent="true", or when decompressing (compress="false") and messageIsContent="true".
ZIP Zip format. It is also used when compressing (compress="true") and resultIsContent="false", or when decompressing (compress="false") and messageIsContent="false".
Required Support a current transaction; create a new one if none exists.
Supports Support a current transaction; execute non-transactionally if none exists.
Mandatory Support a current transaction; throw an exception if no current transaction exists.
RequiresNew Create a new transaction, suspending the current transaction if one exists.
NotSupported Do not support a current transaction; rather always execute non-transactionally.
Never Do not support a current transaction; throw an exception if a current transaction exists.

CompressPipe
Pipes
Pipe to zip or unzip a message or file.
See also
Github - CompressPipe Implementation Examples
Javadoc - org.frankframework.pipes.CompressPipe
Syntax
Copy
<CompressPipe name=""/>
Attributes
Required
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
name	text	-
The functional name of this pipe. It can be referenced by the path attribute of a PipeForward.
Optional
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
compress	boolean	false
If true, the pipe compresses; otherwise, it decompresses.
filenamePattern	text	-
Required if result is a file, the pattern for the result filename. Can be set with variables e.g. {file}.{ext}.zip in this example the {file} and {ext} variables are resolved with sessionKeys with the same name
messageIsContent	boolean	false
A flag that indicates whether the message is the content or the path to a file with the contents. For multiple files, use ';' as a deli
